content: ​ into the 3rd chain up of the starting chain ● 4th croc st round repeat 2nd croc ​ 4 12 v sts st round ​ ● 5th v st round repeat 2nd v st round ​ ● 5th croc st round repeat 2nd croc ​ st round ● 6th v st round repeat 2nd v st round ​ ● 6th croc st round repeat 2nd croc ​ st round ● 2nd croc st round repeat the ​ instructions for the above croc st scale round however you will now anchor your scale down with a single_crochet st over through the base between the 2 double_crochet sts of the v st of the round below 6 scales finishing rounds ● round 1 chain 1 1 single_crochet st in same space ​ work 23 more single_crochet sts evenly around the foundation slip_stitch to top of 1st single_crochet st 24 sts you are securing down the ​ ​​ edges of the scales tip i like to place my ​ ​ single_crochet sts as follows on the edge of the scale middle of the scale over the center between both sides of the scale middle of the 2nd half of the scale and then edge connecting the 2 scales ● round 2 & 3 chain 1 1 single_crochet st in same space and each of the remaining sts around slip_stitch to top of the 1st single_crochet st 24 ​ sts tie off leaving a tail long enough to weave in to create the drawstrings you can go about creating these any way that you see fit if you aren t a fan of the braided drawstring additionally you can add beads to your drawstring as well this of course is just an option and you can go with or without them if you do decide to add beads i recommend finding some with a bit wider of an opening so that you can easily pull your string/yarn ends through them i will do 1 of the 3 strings at a time i like to tie a decent sized knot leaving a little tassel at the end large enough that the bead won t be able to fall off ★ cut 3 strands of your yarn or whatever material you want to use for the drawstrings approx 35 -40 long i like to hold one end down after it has been knotted and the first bead is secured into place with a 2nd knot on the other side of it i then simply do a 3 strand braid until my tie is as long as i want it to be i will then create another decent sized knot to stop the bead from moving up the drawstring ** next ** weave the drawstring side ​ without the bead in and out between stitches i go usually every 2-3 stitches on the finishing top single_crochet st row i like to go between the 2nd and 3rd row but it is your preference i then add
